President Bush at a National Security Council meeting Feb. 3, 2003, in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Colin Powell objected. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as "Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal." Rumsfeld

He predicted that in Tuesday's State of the Union address, Americans will want to hear how Barack Obama is going to bring down the unemployment rate and fix the economy even more than he's fixed it already. Colin Powell said Barack Obama had increased favorability ratings for the U.S. around the world and that the president's "more youthful approach" to international relations had proven "useful."

Daniel Berehulak/Getty Images Simon Cowell LOS ANGELES-- Simon Cowell wants his new Fox talent series "The X Factor" to include controversy, vocal groups and, maybe, Paula Abdul on the judging panel. We've spoken to her, she knows I'm a big fan, Simon Cowell said of his former fellow "American Idol" judge. "I've always said at some point we are going to be working together."
